bug.short_desc: CP info lost under certain circumstances

long_desc.thetext: * DTP 1.0 12/4 build * Although there may be other ways to repro this, here's what I found. Was able to repeat the same steps a number of times. 1. Using the generic JDBC cp, create a connection to MySQL 2. Using the PostgreSQL cp, create a connection to PostgreSQL 3. Connect to both cps in the DSE 4. Multi-select both cps in the DSE and disconnect --> An error log message appears saying that there were problems saving the cp info. 5. Restart Eclipse --> Another error log message saying that the cp info could not be read. Previously created cp are gone from the DSE.
Created an attachment (id=55003) Error log
Note that this also happens if you create to cps for MySQL. In all cases, the connect/disconnect and expansion of tree in DSE works fine -- the only thing wrong is the persistence of the cp info.
This should be fixed for 1.0.

I've checked in a patch for this. Note, I could not duplicate this, but made an educated guess as to what the problem was. I've added synchronization blocks around the use of the document builder and transformer objects. These objects are used during deserialization and serialization of the connection profile data file in the workspace.
John, could you verify that this fixes the problem of a corrupted connection profile data file.
Thanks, Rob
Verified in 12/12 build.
Closing

bug.short_desc: [DataBinding] Data binding breakpoint desired

long_desc.thetext: That sounds reasonable. The debugging project (leeloo) has fallen off the list of priorities at the moment but I might be able to get to this over Christmas. I'll probably have some questions when I get around to implementing it.

I had an idea over the weekend about how to make this could work without me being the bottleneck. The idea was to create a view entitled 'Breakpoint Templates'. Anyone can build a template at any time and there would be ways to contribute them via extension points and probably even copy and paste. A template defines: * Name - used for display * Type - type of object the template is for * Line Number - line number for the breakpoint * Condition - Optional conditional breakpoint code
Then when a breakpoint is hit and the user right clicks on a variable in the variables view. In the context menu it creates a dynamic menu based upon the type of the object and the template types (you only get templates that match the template types using instanceof checks).
This wouldn't give you a different view to view the binding event but the condition could output it to the console which might be good enough. We also have the option of distributing detail formatters for our objects.
I have quite a few ideas what can be done with this (e.g. parameterized conditions, hierarchical menus, etc.) but so far the concept is working. It'll be a little while longer before I have something to distribute, but I have a question. I was thinking about how these breakpoints would be used and when they should be removed. It seems like it would be best to have a menu structure like the following:
Breakpoint Templates > EVENT_COPY_TO_TARGET > Break Once Breakpoint Templates > EVENT_COPY_TO_TARGET > Always Break Breakpoint Templates > EVENT_COPY_TO_TARGET > Other...
This structure would be created for every template. When the first is selected the breakpoint would be removed after it was hit. The second would always break. The third would bring up the breakpoint dialog once the breakpoint was created. What do you think? Are there other options or would these suffice?

Breakpoints can be associated with a specific instance. So when a breakpoint is created using a template from the variables view I can associate it with your binding, the binding just has to be in the variables view. The breakpoint I create will be in ValueBinding, or whatever the binding, when the event is fired rather than in a listener receiving the event. They'll have to be strategically placed.
You are correct, it is just using conditional breakpoints. That's what makes it simple to setup and hopefully familiar.
Let me know if I'm missing something.

(In reply to comment #4) > Breakpoints can be associated with a specific instance. So when a breakpoint > is created using a template from the variables view I can associate it with > your binding, the binding just has to be in the variables view. The breakpoint > I create will be in ValueBinding, or whatever the binding, when the event is > fired rather than in a listener receiving the event. They'll have to be > strategically placed. > > You are correct, it is just using conditional breakpoints. That's what makes > it simple to setup and hopefully familiar. > > Let me know if I'm missing something.
This would gain the effect that I want, but not provide quite as seamless a user experience as I hoped. If you look at the two code examples above, in one case there is a variable that will display in the variables view and so your technique will work there.
But if I never capture the Binding instance in a variable (like in the second example), this won't work. Since a lot of the time we never bother to capture the Binding instance, this would seem to be the preferred way to make a data binding breakpoint work. As an interim solution, your proposal makes sense to me though.
Does this clarify things?

Makes sense, thanks. I agree that it's not seamless but it will apply to a greater number of use cases. One way to make it work with the code provided is to step into the method. Once the instance is created in the method it will be in the current stack frame thus in the variables view.
I'm hoping to get something basic out soon to allow others to play with.

Hmmmm.... If we made the breakpoint() method an instance method rather than a static method, we could simplify the syntax required even further to:
ctx.bind(new Property(finalizeTableViewer, ViewersProperties.CONTENT), new TableModelDescription( new Property( messagesView.getRoot(), ValidatingView.FIELD_ERROR_MESSAGES, StatusMessage.class, true), new String[] { "severity", StatusMessage.MESSAGE }), new BindSpec().setModelToTargetConverters(new IConverter[] { new IntToStatusIconViewerLabelConverter(), null })) .breakpoint(BindingEvent.EVENT_COPY_TO_TARGET, BindingEvent.PIPELINE_AFTER_CHANGE);

I'd be a little concerned about adding API for this. The reason being that we have good tools (AOP) but we're limited at the moment because of support and tooling. But eventually we'll have this in place and the need for the API will diminish. Plus over time debug techniques can change and so can need.

FYI, the plug-in that provides the ability to define breakpoint templates can be found on my update site. Installation and requirements can be found on the google code site[1]. I'll be working on updates, documentation, and probably a screencast or two in the coming week(s). It's currently functional and you can also create a template from an existing breakpoint.
[1] http://code.google.com/p/leeloo/wiki/Installation

There's now a screencast available.
[1] http://code.google.com/p/leeloo/wiki/Screencasts

I've created an extension point and have a plugin contributing templates for ValueBinding. It only works for the 3.3M4 version of data binding. I don't yet have a versioning strategy for them so they will always appear for ValueBinding no matter what the version. That's the next problem to solve.
The support is documented at: http://code.google.com/p/leeloo/wiki/DataBinding
The menus that currently exist are: EVENT_COPY_TO_MODEL PIPELINE_AFTER_GET PIPELINE_AFTER_VALIDATE PIPELINE_AFTER_CONVERT PIPELINE_AFTER_BUSINESS_VALIDATE PIPELINE_AFTER_CHANGE
EVENT_COPY_TO_TARGET PIPELINE_AFTER_GET PIPELINE_AFTER_CONVERT PIPELINE_AFTER_CHANGE PIPELINE_AFTER_VALIDATE
Every template has two options: break once and break all. So the initially requested functionality should be there. When someone gets the time I'd appreciate it if someone could try it out. There are still bugs to fix but it should be in a working state.
I'm thinking about adding options for logging using System.out.println() in conditions and also templates for observable change events.

bug.short_desc: Slip, don't fall (back up the cp info file)

long_desc.thetext: We should save the "last known good" cp info file as a back up to the current one. So, if some situation corrupts the current cp info file, then the back up can be loaded instead (probably with an error message indicating what happened). Currently, if the cp info file is corrupted, all cps are lost. With the back up file, then only the most recently created cp would be lost...

Hey John,
Can you give me some more information on this? For example: When were you seeing this? The circumstances surrounding the problem? etc.
The reason I ask is because there are some strange things that can occur that would make simply implementing a copy of the file moot. I need to figure out when to create the copy and when to use it. Perhaps I just need to think a little longer on the problem, or digress here.
If an error occurs during loading, I can try the backup. If this also fails, we could be in trouble as no profiles will be loaded. When the workspace exits, the main file will be overwritten and will contain no profiles. (Perhaps this is acceptable as this requires two failures.)
If an error occurs during save, I can replace the main file with the backup. This could be done many times until the workspace finally exits, at which time, if a failure occurs again, the backup from the last exit will be used.
And now, my problem. When do I create the copy? After a successful save? Or after a successful load? I guess I'll go with the latter as at least I know the file is readable without error.
What do you think?
Rob
*** Bug 201282 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Created an attachment (id=77152) Proposed fix
Patch that creates and maintains a backup just in case of a JVM crash or similar crash.
Will deliver fix mid-day today unless I hear otherwise from the folks testing it.

Received additional information from person testing the fix. Seems she has had several nasty crashes since I gave her the updated plug-in and hasn't lost any profile work. Great news.
Also, John Graham reviewed the code change and approved it.
Delivered to maintenance and head streams.

bug.short_desc: [No mail notification sent for non-epl CQs when no 3rd party packages listed [was: IPZilla Bugs Appearing In IPZilla but no Notification Received]

long_desc.thetext: There are bugs that appear in IPZilla that the IP Team did not receive an email notification for. Two IPZilla bugs in particular have been found in this regard - 1063 & 1064.
You mean back in November when they were created, or today when you resolved them?
When they were first created we didn't receive an email, though today I could see them to resolve them. We found the inconsistency during our preparation for reporting to the Board.
1074 was submitted today. Can you confirm that you got the e-mail notification?
Confirmed. I received notification on 1074.

Further investigation indicates that no notice is sent out in the following circumstances: 1026 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1027 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1028 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1029 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1030 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1031 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1032 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1033 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1034 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1035 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1036 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1037 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1040 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1041 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1042 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1043 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1058 Manually Entered by IPTeam 1005 Involves Block or Dependency 1008 Involves Block or Dependency 1009 Involves Block or Dependency 1013 Involves Block or Dependency 1014 Involves Block or Dependency 1015 Involves Block or Dependency 1016 Involves Block or Dependency 1018 Involves Block or Dependency 1021 Involves Block or Dependency 1022 Involves Block or Dependency 1024 Involves Block or Dependency 1044 Involves Block or Dependency 1048 Involves Block or Dependency 1049 Involves Block or Dependency 1050 Involves Block or Dependency 1051 Involves Block or Dependency 1054 Involves Block or Dependency 1055 Involves Block or Dependency 1056 Involves Block or Dependency 1062 Involves Block or Dependency 1071 Involves Block or Dependency 1073 Involves Block or Dependency 1076 Involves Block or Dependency 1077 Involves Block or Dependency 1079 Involves Block or Dependency 1000 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time 1003 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time 1006 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time 1019 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time 1063 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time 1064 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time 1065 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time 1066 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time 1067 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time 1038 Entry of CQ Discontinued After First Page 1011 Unknown 1052 Unknown 1059 Unknown As a result, Committers and the PMC is not made aware of the need to attach code to the IPBug or have the PMC vote +1 on the IPBug in order for the review of the submission to proceed. In all cases except manual entry by the the IPTeam such a notice is needed. This Bug is also related to Bug 166278.

> Manually Entered by IPTeam Check your E-mail Prefs. Make sure "change was made by me" options are all checked if you want to receive your own notices, or click "Enable all mail". How did you manage to bypass the CQ and enter them manually?
> 1079 Involves Block or Dependency You won't receive mail for these as the "parent", 1078, was sent listing all the dependants. If a CQ involves 30 third-party packages, I'm sure you don't want everyone to receive 31 e-mails. One e-mail is sent with a list of all the packages, correct?
> 1000 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time > 1038 Entry of CQ Discontinued After First Page
Both of these are the same. It's related to the problem we discussed where a non-epl CQ is entered without there being a list of at least one third-party package. After the first CQ page is created, a Bug entry (1000, 1038 etc) is created to properly establish dependencies (this is the "parent". Once the second page of the CQ is sent, then one single summary e-mail is sent listing all the packages (the "children"). If the submitter never actually submits page 2, I have no way of knowing they "bailed out" as we assumed a completed CQ involved submitting both pages.
> 1011 Unknown > 1052 Unknown > 1059 Unknown
As above, these appear to be non-epl CQs that were not completed correctly, as IPZilla wasn't designed to send an e-mail without there being a list of third-party packages.
So the problem here is not that no notifications were sent, but that in the case where a non-epl CQ is entered without filling a list of third-party packages.
We need to discuss how this should work.

> 1079 Involves Block or Dependency You won't receive mail for these as the "parent", 1078, was sent listing all the dependants. If a CQ involves 30 third-party packages, I'm sure you don't want everyone to receive 31 e-mails. One e-mail is sent with a list of all the packages, correct? - We need to have one email sent for each IPZilla entry so that the committer and PMC are aware that the source code needs to be attached for each and that the PMC must vote +1 on each submission.
> 1000 Involves Multiple Components Added at Same Time > 1038 Entry of CQ Discontinued After First Page > 1011 Unknown > 1052 Unknown > 1059 Unknown This issue should resolve with the resolution of Bug 166278. Correct?

(In reply to comment #7) > This issue should resolve with the resolution of Bug 166278. Correct?
Correct. I have this bug and bug 166278 fixed on a test IPZilla. I'm simply waiting for confirmation on bug 166278.
This has been fixed, as per comment 8.
Closing.

bug.short_desc: XML Editor "Save As" causes error message in design view

long_desc.thetext:
Platform: Eclipse 3.2.1 WTP 1.5.2
To reproduce: 1) Use Save As to save a file open in the XML editor. 2) Switch to the design view to see a "Cannot display document contents" message overlaid on the tree.
The tree appears to work just fine, but the overlay will not disappear until you reopen the file.

Created an attachment (id=55005) ScreenshotFor166705.png
Screenshot that shows the error on the design page after the Save As

Created an attachment (id=55006) PatchFor166705.txt
Patch file that fixes the bug in WTP 1.5.2

The patch is appreciated, but connectDesignPage() and disconnectDesignPage() aren't "balanced" in the way that the patch expects. Listeners are added during connect that aren't removed during the disconnect, largely because disconnect was only intended to be called during dispose().
Setting the document into the design page after the model had been created is the safest change to make, though.
Created an attachment (id=55164) updated patch - calls setDocument() directly
CCing David Williams for approval in 1.5.3 branch; I'll drop the target milestone back if so.
Closing as fixed since WTP 1.5.3. Please reopen if closed in error.

long_desc.thetext:
Due to the bug 147106, currently EPF will fail if users try to use Add to Source to add an entire librray to source control under ClearCase. This bug should be fixed when bug 147106 is fixed.
Created this bug so QA can track this issue and test it accodringly.
fix for bug 147106 should resolve this bug too. resolve this bug now so QA can test this issue.
Fix is verified on build EPF 1.0.2-1213-1400, now user can add current library to source control correctly.
Verified, close it.

bug.short_desc: JSP validator uses incorrect line mapping for some error indicators

long_desc.thetext:
Platform: Eclipse 3.2.1 and WTP 1.5.2
Steps to reproduce: 1) Create a web project 2) Create a JSP page containing only the following 2 lines of text:
<%@ include file="../../includes/FormError.jsp" %> <html lang="<%= request.getParameter(\"lang\") %>" />
3) Save the file and note the errors. 4) Ignore the error on the include statement. 5) The page has two errors on line 3 - the quotes in JSP experession are escaped: getParameter(\"lang\") should be getParameter("lang") 6) The error message for the quotes is correct but the error marker has the wrong position. It shows the path to included page as the error location. If you will fix the problem by removing the escapes on the quotes, error markers will be gone.
If the same error was in a location other than an attribute list, error marker shows in the correct location.

Created an attachment (id=55009) PatchFor166709.txt
The patch fixes this issue in WTP 1.5.2. Also, please note that this bug appears to be a regression caused by the fix for Bug #119633.

Namespace is not required by IHE standards. The requirements are: - namespaceId only * or * - assigningAuthority universalID and universalIdType * or * - all 3
If you are used to working with Initiate, Initiate does require that all 3 be present. But when querying within MESA you will see it test that you can support these options.
Does this answer your question??
Yes, that answers it. I'm guessing this shouldn't be a problem, then.
ok to close then
closing

bug.short_desc: Infopops for Generate DDL wizard not working

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1.Right-click a database object under a connection in the Database Explorer view. 2.Press F1.
More information: The dynamic help view opens, but the text at the top of the view says: "The context help for this user interface element could not be found."

In the interest of bugzilla bookkeeping, I'm marking all the old RBD bugs as "won't fix" since no further maintenance is planned for that component.
If you still have some issues with database tools I suggest you use and open bugs against the Eclipse DTP Project.
We do appreciate you helping us by opening the bug, though, and apologize it was not able to be resolved in a better and more timely manner.

bug.short_desc: [DataBinding] fix for 164653 broke the suites

long_desc.thetext: The code checked in for bug 164653 broke the test suites. Both DetailObservableValue and DetailObservableValueTest are in the same package but in different plug-ins and DetailObservableValue is package private. This results in an illegal access exception when running the suites. You DID run the suites right... ;)
I've checked in a temporary fix - I've made DetailObservableValue public.
The tests suites were definitely ran but maybe not as a plug-in JUnit.
Also this is what bug 166600 is about. I'm assuming that bug 166600 should be marked as INVALID and we should just make all classes public even though we don't rely upon OSGi.

bug.short_desc: Cannot delete process in practice reference

long_desc.thetext: Steps: 1. Create a practice and a process (CP or DP) 2. Add process to content elements in practice reference tag 3. The added process cannot be deleted by press "remove" button
Fixed.
Fix is verified on EPF 1.2 Build Label: 20070222-1427.
Fix is verified on EPF 1.2 20070314-1900. Close it.

bug.short_desc: Table properties in RTE have no effect in preview or browse view

long_desc.thetext: Steps: 1. Insert a table in RTE 2. Switch to HTML source tag 3. Modify the table bolder value from 1 to 0 4. Switch back to Rich text tag, the table bolder shows null (correct behavior) 5. Preview or browse this element, the table bolder shows as 1 (incorrect behavior)
Remember you have to save the element between steps 4 and 5. Preview/browse read the saved element, not the dirty editor.
Thanks Jeff. Close it as usage error.

bug.short_desc: JMerge: map(JNode,JNode) is called twice in insertClone

long_desc.thetext: The mapChildren(JNode,JNode) method calls map(JNode,JNode), so the latter doesn't need to called explicitly.
The fix is committed to CVS.

bug.short_desc: JMerger: sort rule is not applied when sorting 2 nodes

long_desc.thetext: The method JMerger.sortTargetCompilationUnit() only applies the sort rules if the number of nodes to be sorted is greater than 2. It should do it for >= cases.
The fix is committed to CVS.

bug.short_desc: [Markers]MarkerResolutionDialog's markersTable should have location entry consistent with the problems view

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: currently in the MarkerResolutionDialog, it display the list of markers in the markersTable. But the table only has 2 columns, name and line info. If the line info is not available , it just displays "Unknown" which is not very useful. It should at least displays the same columns as in Problems view or allow user/plugin developer to configure which columns should be displayed.
The markersTable's columns are not resizeable. It makes it difficult to see the text if it is larger than column width.
More information:
They are resizable in 3.3 RC1
This was fixed in 3.3

bug.short_desc: [Regression]Exception is thrown out when insert a svg image [0001]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Exception is thrown out when insert a svg image as an Embedded image, Exception is thrown out when preview the svg image in resource folder in "Edit Image Item" page.
Build number: 2.1.2.v20061205-0710
Steps to reproduce: 1. Drag Image from Palette to Layout, choose Embedded image, add the attached svg image. 2. Put the attached svg image in resource folder, drag Image from Palette to Layout, choose Image file in BIRT resource folder, add the attached svg image, click preivew button, preview in Layout.
Expected result: No exception is thrown out.
Actual result: 1. Exception is thrown out in step 1, 2. Exception is thrown out when preview in "Edit Image Item" page, and when preview in Layout it works correctly.
Error log: Unsupported or unrecognized format Plug-in Provider:Eclipse.org Plug-in Name:BIRT Designer UI Plug-in ID:org.eclipse.birt.report.designer.ui Version:2.1.2.v20061205-0710 Error Code:Error.GUIException.invokedBySWTException Error Message:Unsupported or unrecognized format
Created an attachment (id=55012) svg file

It works well here. Please install SVG viewer before you use a svg image. I suggest you turn to Yi Sun.
Set this bug to WORKSFORME.
Closed.

bug.short_desc: Enhancement: Only show the xml structure based on the xml source when the xml has schema[0701]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Enhancement: Only show the xml structure based on the xml source when the xml has schema[0701]
Build number: 2.2.0.v20061205-0710
Steps to reproduce: 1, New a XML data source with a XML file and its schema file 2, Preview the XML Structure after select the table mapping
Expected result: Only show the basic XML file structure, because the user wants to get the structure based on the XML file structure, not including the other structure in Schema
Actual result: According to the schema the parser parse out all the possible structure, and lay out in the XML Structure.
Error log: N/A

Bug Fixed.
Methods getSchemaTree in SchemaPopulationUtil were modified which can take both xml and xsd file name as parameters, where a comparison between the xml root tag name and xsd tag names will be done. In this case, if the xml root tag name matches one in the xsd file, then only the xml struture specified in xsd will be populated, otherwise, the whole structure of xsd will be populated
thanks a lot, closed

bug.short_desc: Report item with predefined style extended from library doesn't work in report [0300]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: Report item with predefined style extended from library doesn't work in report.
Build number: 2.1.2.v20061205-0710
Steps to reproduce: 1. New a library with a label and a predefined style "label". 2. Publish the library to the resource folder. 3. New a report and extended the label from the library.
Expected result: The predefined style works on the label in the report.
Actual result: It does not work.
Error log: N/A
The behavior is right. And we can't inherit selector from parent. So close it.

bug.short_desc: [Linux]setImageDirectory() method is no effect[0600]

long_desc.thetext:
Description: [Linux]setImageDirectory() method is no effect[0600]
Step: 1.Run the test case by junit. You can find out the case on: /cvsroot/org.eclipse.birt.report.tests.engine/src/org/eclipse/birt/report/tests/engine/regression/Regression_142894.java /cvsroot/org.eclipse.birt.report.tests.engine/src/org/eclipse/birt/report/tests/engine/regression/input/regression_142894.rptdesign /cvsroot/org.eclipse.birt.report.tests.engine/src/org/eclipse/birt/report/tests/engine/regression/input/pics/green.bmp
2.In render task, we set that "renderContext.setImageDirectory( "image" );"
Actual result: The background image path is "pics/green.bmp" in html code. But the image is save at "image/green.bmp"
Model should process the File.separatorChar between windows and linux.
Windows File.separator is converted / when finds the image.
The bug is still exist
This is the relative path to design file, not to resource folder.
fix it
Verified and closed

bug.short_desc: [refactoring scripts] Refactoring script can't be applied to dependent projects

long_desc.thetext:
I've tried to use refactoring scripts to update dependent projects to new API, but apparently it does not work like thought.
Mylar team has been carefully committing refactoring history to CVS. I thought that I can checkout Mylar from CVS, generate refactoring script for the period since my last integration and then apply that script on my own projects that have dependencies on Mylar. So far, so good. I got the project, refactoring history and even generated script. But when I was trying to apply this script it failed, complaining that class moved by refactoring is not there. Since refactoring already been applied to Mylar this class is already in its new location.
So, I think that wizard for applying refactoring scripts should allow to ignore/skip these warnings if files participated in refactoring are not found, but after that should search refactoring participants in this new workspace (those participants that didn't exist when refactoring was created in first place, e.g. new projects, classes, etc).
It would also make sense to allow to choose what projects should participate when refactoring script is applied. So, user can speed things up and could avoid scanning the whole workspace.

To use refactoring scripts, you need Mylar in the original source version, with your code, everything compiling fine and then perform the scripts so we can guarantee that the refacturing does 100% accurate changes. That only works if Mylar is in source.
If you have Mylar in binary and they use the refactoring history, you don't need to use refactoring scripts but can use 'Migrate JAR...' to update the JAR. The action must again be applied on the original JAR and a compiling workspace. Unfortunatly this only works if the JAR in not in a container.
I think it makes sense to migrate a full workspace, saying everybody who references the refactored sources or libs. That's how refactoring always work. As in all refactorings you can exclude changes on the preview page.
I agree that the whole process needs some polishing. We should make sure it also works in the PDE container setup.

Martin, I know that it will work on the sources, but I think user should be allowed to take a risk and apply scripts without modifying source code for the originating component. Since that code is under version control, user will end up with outgoing changes on that code, and it is better to avoid these kinds of things.
I also think that support for containers is quite critical. Note that PDE is not the only source of classpatch containers and it should be transparent for other container types.
Worth to mention, that my attempts to use migrate jars has failed in the past. After migrating some jar from within workspace I ended up with build path pointing to jar outside of workspace (even if new jar is sitting in the same folder as old one), which is not what I would expected. Though it is a separate issue.

Input content in body as: <birt:viewer id="1" reportDesign="birt_tag_sample.rptdesign" > </birt:viewer> <birt:viewer id="1" reportDesign="birt_tag_sample1.rptdesign" > </birt:viewer>. 3. Run the project on Server and type http://localhost:port/$context_root/$jspFileName.jsp
Expected result: Error message about duplicate id property value.
Actual result: Only the second report displayed.
Another issue: If I changed id to "-1", the frame containing the report couldn't showed up, either. I tried several characters and only "$" and "_" could work. Do we have any constraint in id value?
Error log:N/A
If contain duplicate viewer id, throw error message. And also validate the viewer id. Viewer id should contain number, letter or underline.

bug.short_desc: update site should link to third party companion update sites

long_desc.thetext:
Mylar update site should link to companion update sites, such as Subclipse and Subversive integrations as well as other 3rd party connectors.
See https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=165581#c22
PS: Mik, here is what Mike meant. I can't copy direct link to your comment from Bugzilla editor and I can only link to the web UI from here.
Do you have an update site for me to link to, e.g. a Subclipse one? I might also be able to try with the subversive one.

Hey! It takes several days to you to review and apply some tiny patches and I had only few hours since you resolved API issues in a team... I am not that fast.
Anyways, I guess Subclipse update site is going to be at http://subclipse.tigris.org/update_1.2.x
Yes, sorry, was not meaning to imply that you could get this turned around instantly.

(In reply to comment #3) > Yes, sorry, was not meaning to imply that you could get this turned around > instantly.
You don't have to be sorry. I am not as sensitive as you know who. Just being cheeky as usual. :-)
Besides, you can still use subversive update site as a playground...
We can still try to have this for 1.0, or to update the site.xml file shortly thereafter, but first we need to ensure that the Subclipse and Subversive sites work standalone.
If Mylar links to other 3rd party connectors, we would like if our connector from update site: "http://www.trackplus.com/files/update-site/e3.2/trackplus-mylar" might be refered also.

Update sites for the beta version of Codebeamer repository connector is available:
http://cbconnector.javaforge.com/update/codebeamer-3.2 http://cbconnector.javaforge.com/update/codebeamer-3.3

(In reply to comment #6) > If Mylar links to other 3rd party connectors, we would like if our connector > from update site: > "http://www.trackplus.com/files/update-site/e3.2/trackplus-mylar" > might be refered also.
You may also want to add a note about your connector to http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php?title=Mylar_Integrators .

This did not make into Friday's 2.0M1 update site because we need to give integrators a chance to move to the 2.0M1 APIs if they choose to do so (I plan on sending out the porting email by tomorrow).
Adrian: please consider expanding on the Trac+ entry that Steffen added.

I added entries for each of the tools mentioned on the bug to following page, now linked from our navigation bar: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_Extensions
Each contains an update site. Could everyone CC'd please make sure that their update site and description are correct or update as necessary?
Mik, we can probably maintain a separate aggregating update site that can link those external update sites together in one place.
Eugene: that sounds good to me, at least to start. Do you want to take a stab at creating it?

Here you are:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <site associateSitesURL="http://download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/extensions/associateSites.xml"> </site>
and associateSites.xml look something like this:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <associateSites>
<associateSite label="Subclipse 1.2.x" url="http://subclipse.tigris.org/update_1.2.x/"/>
<associateSite label="Subversive" url="http://www.polarion.org/projects/subversive/download/1.1/update-site/"/>
<associateSite label="Maven Integration" url="http://m2eclipse.codehaus.org/update/"/>
<associateSite label="Maven Integration (dev)" url="http://m2eclipse.codehaus.org/update-dev/"/>
<associateSite label="PyDev" url="http://pydev.sourceforge.net/updates/site.xml"/>
<associateSite label="CodeBeamer Repository Connector for Eclipse 3.2" url="http://cbconnector.javaforge.com/update/codebeamer-3.2/"/> <associateSite label="CodeBeamer Repository Connector for Eclipse 3.3" url="http://cbconnector.javaforge.com/update/codebeamer-3.3/"/>
<associateSite label="Track+ Repository Connector" url="http://www.trackplus.com/files/update-site/e3.2/trackplus-mylar"/>
</associateSites>

To do this effectively we will need to start a process similar to the Europa release train, where integrators are responsible for updating their associated sites to ensure that they support the corresponding version of Mylar. I plan on posting a proposal for this next week and would like to have the departure of the train be the 2.0 release.

It turns out that are legal implications to doing this on eclipse.org. We are exploring how best to do this, but might not have it resolved by June 29th. I'd like to do it as soon as possible after the 29th and if we can't make it happen on eclipse.org for that time it might make sense to prototype it on an external site until we can move it to eclipse.org.

bug.short_desc: [misc] Allow to call validateEdit each time

long_desc.thetext: When a file is read-only, eclipse invokes an edit event only once when the user tries to modify the file. This should be a configurable option so that the user can choose to get a notification every time. Some team provider implementations rely on this event to ask for check-out of the file. Because of the default behavior, once the user confirms "No", subsequently there is no event, and unless the user re-opens the file, there won't be any prompt to check-out the file.
This behaviour might be coming from your repository provider. What kind of repository are you using?
This behavior is provided by the Text component.

Steps To Reproduce: 1.Create a Clable. 2.Set some text contains some combining characters(Here we use \u0041\u0300) 3.Set the Clable to grab excessive horizontal space. 4.Run the program, resize the Clabel till the layout change. 5.Problem occurs.
More information: The method "shortenText()" shorten the given text t so that its length doesn't exceed the given width. The default implementation replaces characters in the center of the original string with an ellipsis ("..."). If the original string contains some combining characters, problems will occur.
Created an attachment (id=55019) The snapshot of the problem.
The combining character A(\u0041\u0300) in this case was spitted into two code point 'A' and '' respectively when layout changed.
Created an attachment (id=55023) The detail snapshot of this problem.

combining with similar report
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 166745 ***

bug.short_desc: Dropping issue into task list query should update it to match query criteria

long_desc.thetext:
This idea came from the discussion at tss thread about standalone jira client. http://www.theserverside.com/news/thread.tss?thread_id=43279
Dropping issue into task list query should update the issue to match query criteria. For example change assignment, priority or due date attributes.
We may also allow drag-n-drop of the tasks from task list view (local and not-local) to the repositories in Task Repositories view as a quick way to transform local task into repository task.
Later on, if we'll support repository model contributions in Task Repositories view, same drag-n-drop into the models could be allowed as well and could work same way as for queries.
Please mark enhancement requests as such.

bug.short_desc: Named parameters to ODA Query

long_desc.thetext:
In my ODA dataSet implementation, I use interface com.mg.merp.wb.report.birt.data.oda.badi.IQuery methods public void setSomething( String parameterName, int value ), which set parameters by name, has never been executed. But for my custom dataset I need named parameters. I think, that the problem is in org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.DataSourceQuery,
...addParameterDefns().. .................. if ( isParameterPositionValid(parameterHint.getPosition( )) ) this.setInputParamValue( parameterHint.getPosition( ),inputValue ); else this.setInputParamValue( parameterHint.getName( ),inputValue ); .......
I couldn't invoke 'else' branch, because isParameterPositionValid() always returns 'true' >>return parameterPosition > 0; Ku.
seems be DTE's bug.
I think it's only fair to choose position over name, although you can try set position to -1

Hi Valentin,
This is about the strategy of populate parameter value. When a parameter has a position as well as parameter name, both of which are valid, which one should take priority? In our implementation we make position prior to the name.
As the code quoted by you:
if ( isParameterPositionValid(parameterHint.getPosition( )) ) this.setInputParamValue( parameterHint.getPosition( ),inputValue ); else this.setInputParamValue( parameterHint.getName( ),inputValue );
The only chance that above code run to problem is that certain parameter hint is defined as its position not match its name, and you want its name take priority.
However, as parameter hint is freely definable by user (It is usually a mapping populated during design time, which contains values returned IQuery.getParameterMetaData() and custom default values), the problem could possibly be: com.mg.merp.wb.report.birt.data.oda.badi.IQuery.getParameterMetaData() has not returned correct parameter information(its position does not match its name).
The code you quoted is the internal logic of BIRT Data Engine.Its behavior decided by external output, "Parameter Hint" in this case. The parameter hint is setable using BaseDataSetDesign.addInputParameterBindings method. I do not know in your application how you construct BaseDataSetDesign(If you talk to DtE directly), or org.eclipse.birt.report.model.elements.DataSet(If you talk to BIRT model).However we are sure that in both of them you can define you parameter position to "-1".
Thanks. Lin

1. In BIRT Data Engine my parameters have correct values with names and positions. But how can I set param position for my query to -1 manually(in design time, or in ODA driver)? 2. IMHO when org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.IDataSetMetaData method public boolean supportsNamedParameters() throws OdaException; returns "true", named parameters must have priority. Or, maybe, another way is to set both param by name and by index? And developer in his ODA driver implementation chooses which of them have higer priority Ku.

(In reply to comment #5) > 1. In BIRT Data Engine my parameters have correct values with names and > positions. I am a bit confused here. If the parametershave correct values with both name and position, then what is the problem we use its position to pass the parameter value? Do you mean the ODA driver you used does not support passing parameter by position?
> But how can I set param position for my query to -1 manually(in design time, > or in ODA driver)? In design time, if you are using BIRT Model, you can manipulate data stored in org.eclipse.birt.report.model.elements.DataSet to set a "-1" value manually to param position.
> 2. IMHO when org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.IDataSetMetaData method > public boolean supportsNamedParameters() throws OdaException; returns "true", > named parameters must have priority. By default, all the driver should support setting parameter using parameter position.
The method supportsNamedParameters() is used to indicate user that the parameter name can also be used to populate the parameter, however, this should not prevent driver from support parameter position. The using of parameter name is a supplement of parameter position rather than a replacement.So maybe we should not let the parameter name take the priority.
>Or, maybe, another way is to set both > param by name and by index? And developer in his ODA driver implementation > chooses which of them have higer priority Actually the ODA driver implementation would not do such work. The conflict exists in BIRT rather than ODA.When position and name have conflict, BIRT needs to decide which method in ODA implementation to call, setXXX(name,value) or setXXX(index, value).ODA driver would not meet name/index conflict at all.
Thank you! Lin

>> 1. In BIRT Data Engine my parameters have correct values with names and >> positions. >I am a bit confused here. If the parametershave correct values with both name >and position, then what is the problem we use its position to pass the >parameter value? Do you mean the ODA driver you used does not support passing >parameter by position?
My query is specific, so I need named parameters. If I set params by position I need to know their names too.
>> But how can I set param position for my query to -1 manually(in design time, >> or in ODA driver)? >In design time, if you are using BIRT Model, you can manipulate data stored in >org.eclipse.birt.report.model.elements.DataSet to set a "-1" value manually to >param position.
It's not a good feng shui to make users to edit report XML source. Maybe create a check box similar to "prefer named params", and birt will set positions to -1 automatically.
>The method supportsNamedParameters() is used to indicate user that the >parameter name can also be used to populate the parameter, however, this should >not prevent driver from support parameter position. The using of parameter name >is a supplement of parameter position rather than a replacement.So maybe we >should not let the parameter name take the priority. I think, that driver must have gate to dataset param names and to report param names.
P.S. Not according to subj, but... Why doesn't BIRT have such useful things as extension points on export format, data types for query (because people need to use not only SQL types) and report parameters, parameters display type etc?

(In reply to comment #7) > >> 1. In BIRT Data Engine my parameters have correct values with names and > >> positions. > >I am a bit confused here. If the parametershave correct values with both name > >and position, then what is the problem we use its position to pass the > >parameter value? Do you mean the ODA driver you used does not support passing > >parameter by position? > > My query is specific, so I need named parameters. If I set params by position > I > need to know their names too.
That is, your ODA driver still support set parameter value using its position, is that right?If so, I think there would be of no problem for BIRT Data Engine to pass the parameter value using its position to ODA driver.
The work flow of a paramter would like follows: Model -> BIRT Engine -> BIRT Data Engine-> ODA implementation
If the parameter position is set up correctly in model(by UI), then it can be correctly passed to ODA.
So I do not understand how this affect your specific problem.Can you provide more specific info?
> >> But how can I set param position for my query to -1 manually(in design time, > >> or in ODA driver)? > >In design time, if you are using BIRT Model, you can manipulate data stored in > >org.eclipse.birt.report.model.elements.DataSet to set a "-1" value manually to > >param position. > > It's not a good feng shui to make users to edit report XML source. Maybe create > a check box similar to "prefer named params", and birt will set positions to -1 > automatically. Only ODA UI implementation would be responsible to edit report XML source. User needn't edit report XML source at all.User only talks to ODA implementation UI and it is ODA implementation UI's responsibility to set the parameter position to -1 in case of necessary.
> >The method supportsNamedParameters() is used to indicate user that the > >parameter name can also be used to populate the parameter, however, this should > >not prevent driver from support parameter position. The using of parameter name > >is a supplement of parameter position rather than a replacement.So maybe we > >should not let the parameter name take the priority. > I think, that driver must have gate to dataset param names and to report param > names. The driver does provide you data set parameter meta info using IParameterMetadata interface, though it have no idea with report parameter.
> P.S. > Not according to subj, but... > Why doesn't BIRT have such useful things as extension points on export format, > data types for query (because people need to use not only SQL types) and report > parameters, parameters display type etc? > Data type support is a very complex issue and BIRT currently only support a set of proved most useful data types.Almost all other kind of Data types can be converted to the data types BIRT supported(Some Date types may make exceptions,and we have planned to enhance them already). Accompany with those data types BIRT provide a series of build-in script methods so that they can be easily manipulated. Can you provide some specific cases that current BIRT data type support cannot handle(again, except for date types) so that we can make investigation to this issue a bit further?
Thank you for your input very much! Lin

> That is, your ODA driver still support set parameter value using its position, > is that right?If so, I think there would be of no problem for BIRT Data Engine > to pass the parameter value using its position to ODA driver. Passing the parameter value using its position isn't for my situation. That's my model: 1.User creates some report template with my dataset, which is only metadata for any table(i.e. fields names and their types). Query is the code of special algorithm, which is performed on jboss server. 2.BIRT engine is embeded in jboss. When user wants to print some report(not from birt), my jboss mbean redirects it to birt, and in jboss environment ODA driver may call special algorithm, which creates some dataset(not oda:)) only collection)and fills them. But in this algorithm to get oda datset params is not so easy, because in subreport algorithm for detail doesn't know about master algorithm. Detail algorithm only gets param by name and uses it, because if somebody changes dataset params position order all algorithms may crush. In brief: for my situation to use params by positions is impossible.:)
> Only ODA UI implementation would be responsible to edit report XML source. > User > needn't edit report XML source at all.User only talks to ODA implementation UI > and it is ODA implementation UI's responsibility to set the parameter position > to -1 in case of necessary. Do U mean, that I should create this stuff as well, which will set pos to -1?
> Data type support is a very complex issue and BIRT currently only support a > set > of proved most useful data types.Almost all other kind of Data types can be > converted to the data types BIRT supported(Some Date types may make > exceptions,and we have planned to enhance them already). Accompany with those > data types BIRT provide a series of build-in script methods so that they can > be > easily manipulated. Can you provide some specific cases that current BIRT data > type support cannot handle(again, except for date types) so that we can make > investigation to this issue a bit further? Boolean

(In reply to comment #9) > > That is, your ODA driver still support set parameter value using its position, > > is that right?If so, I think there would be of no problem for BIRT Data Engine > > to pass the parameter value using its position to ODA driver. > Passing the parameter value using its position isn't for my situation. That's > my model: > 1.User creates some report template with my dataset, which is only metadata for > any table(i.e. fields names and their types). Query is the code of special > algorithm, which is performed on jboss server. > 2.BIRT engine is embeded in jboss. When user wants to print some report(not > from birt), my jboss mbean redirects it to birt, and in jboss environment ODA > driver may call special algorithm, which creates some dataset(not oda:)) only > collection)and fills them. But in this algorithm to get oda datset params is > not so easy, because in subreport algorithm for detail doesn't know about > master algorithm. > Detail algorithm only gets param by name and uses it, because if somebody > changes dataset params position order all algorithms may crush. In brief: for > my situation to use params by positions is impossible.:) Can you tell me how your program talk to BIRT engine? Generally BIRT engine will accept BIRT model as input.If so maybe you can do something in BIRT model(Say, set parameter position to -1 in BIRT module handle) so that BIRT data engine will by then set the parameter to ODA driver by their names rather than positions.
> > Only ODA UI implementation would be responsible to edit report XML source. > > User > > needn't edit report XML source at all.User only talks to ODA implementation UI > > and it is ODA implementation UI's responsibility to set the parameter position > > to -1 in case of necessary. > Do U mean, that I should create this stuff as well, which will set pos to -1? > > > Data type support is a very complex issue and BIRT currently only support a > > set > > of proved most useful data types.Almost all other kind of Data types can be > > converted to the data types BIRT supported(Some Date types may make > > exceptions,and we have planned to enhance them already). Accompany with those > > data types BIRT provide a series of build-in script methods so that they can > > be > > easily manipulated. Can you provide some specific cases that current BIRT data > > type support cannot handle(again, except for date types) so that we can make > > investigation to this issue a bit further? > Boolean >

> Can you tell me how your program talk to BIRT engine? Generally BIRT engine > will accept BIRT model as input.If so maybe you can do something in BIRT > model(Say, set parameter position to -1 in BIRT module handle) so that BIRT > data engine will by then set the parameter to ODA driver by their names rather > than positions. Forget it, I'm workaround this problem, I just want to have standart way to resolv this problem. But I think, that in design mode user must have possibility to select between named and numered parameters, because now BIRT is single-purpose for SQL types, params and other, but it's not the one. Though make ext point for this possibility.
> > > Data type support is a very complex issue and BIRT currently only support a > > > set > > > of proved most useful data types.Almost all other kind of Data types can be > > > converted to the data types BIRT supported(Some Date types may make > > > exceptions,and we have planned to enhance them already). Accompany with those > > > data types BIRT provide a series of build-in script methods so that they can > > > be > > > easily manipulated. Can you provide some specific cases that current BIRT data > > > type support cannot handle(again, except for date types) so that we can make > > >investigation to this issue a bit further? > > Boolean Ye, the boolean type is realy need, I don't whant pass boolean through string "true/false" or int 0/1
P.S. Are U make ">" simbols by hands? :))
Ku.

Hi~
First I would like to clarify that the ">" is insert to the text automatically rather than typed in by me :).
Second, yes you do find a critical important data type that missed in BIRT, that is, boolean type. Actually we are aware of that and ready for support it. The bugzilla number to trace that issue in BIRT is 152443.This bug is however depending on DTP bug 127234 :(, which is targeting DTP release 1.5.Because we use DTP ODA as our data source, BIRT cannot support Boolean type standalone.
Last and most important, hm, thank you for your kind inputting in this bug.We do have room to improve our behavior.We will do investigation to the issue and collect more information/feedback from users to see when and how to make enhancement.
Thanks :) Lin
That's Ku. And don't forget about extension points to report export format, data types and other useful stuff :) Ku.

For report export extension point, BIRT already support export report as pdf, html, etc. User can certainly define their own report export extension.
The boolean type is already supported in latest BIRT build.
So this bug can be marked as resolved now:)
Thanks. Lin
Bug theme was "Named parameters to ODA Query". Extension points for export, and boolean type is not cover it. (look at the 1st post)

Hi Valentin,
As I've commented, we support named parameters to ODA query, however, in case that a parameter's position is not consistent with its name, we will take its position as priority.Please see my #4.
Thanks. Lin

As in parameter position and parameter name conflicting, we can only take one of them for prority. Because in most of JDBC driver parameter position is prefered, we would follow this convention.This bug will not be fixed.
But wich mechanizm I need to use for named parameters. I don't understand it. Params stored in array, so their number can't be < 0

Hi,
The valid ParameterHint should qualified for following condition: whether we set parameter value by using its index or its name, we can always get same result after query execution.
If the ParameterHint is invalid, that is, the above process cannot get same results, we will simply take parameter index for priority.
As client for DataEngine, you need to ensure one of following: A)ensure setting of parameter value by index/name can get same execution result B)If you set parameter index to valid value, meanwhile the parameter name are incorrect, then you must make sure that setting parameter value by index can give the result you want C)If you do not want we use parameter index to set parameter, then you should set the index value to -1 so that we will set the parameter value based on parameter name.
Thanks. Lin

bug.short_desc: The globalization problems dealing with the shortcut key in CTabFolder.

Moving to FH to consider; CTabFolder makes its tab traversal decision in CTabFolder.onMnemonic(). I'm not sure if these characters are really considered to be equivalent in this context, but FH has more experience with this.
TabFolder works fine on this case. We can fix this by using event.keycode instead of event.character in CTabFolder and CLabel.

The character "i" and \u0131 are not the same. If the mnemonic is set to the Turkish "i" (\u0131), then the user must press it for the mnemonic to fire. Pressing "i" is not the same thing, even though they might draw the same.
Am I missing something?

The following ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException occurs from time to time (with a different index). Sorry, i could not find a way to reproduce this bug:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-12-05 08:23:06.281 !MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "C/C++ Indexer". !STACK 0 java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -48886 at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Database.getChunk(Database.java:109) at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Database.putInt(Database.java:248) at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Database.addBlock(Database.java:216) at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.Database.free(Database.java:233) at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.db.ShortString.delete(ShortString.java:70) at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.dom.PDOMMacro.delete(PDOMMacro.java:80) at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.dom.PDOMFile.clear(PDOMFile.java:199) at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullHandleDelta.removeTU(PDOMFullHandleDelta.java:208) at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullHandleDelta.run(PDOMFullHandleDelta.java:97) at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.PDOMIndexerJob.run(PDOMIndexerJob.java:60) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58) !SESSION 2006-12-05 08:30:33.968 -----------------------------------------------

org.eclipse.birt.core.exception.CoreException: Can not convert the value of 2006-12-12 00:00:00.0 GMT+0800 to Date type. at org.eclipse.birt.core.data.DataTypeUtil.toDate(DataTypeUtil.java:504) at org.eclipse.birt.core.data.DataTypeUtil.toDate(DataTypeUtil.java:923) at org.eclipse.birt.core.data.DataTypeUtil.toDate(DataTypeUtil.java:380) at org.eclipse.birt.core.data.DataTypeUtil.convert(DataTypeUtil.java:141) at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.DataSourceQuery.convertToValue(DataSourceQuery.java:697)

In DtE, a data set parameter value is stored in String format. When we accept a parameter value from outside, we will first convert it to a string and then convert it back to it original value when it is actually used (say, be set to IQuery of ODA).
To ensure a seamless Object->String->Object converting, when meet a Date value, DtE use pattern yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.S z to convert it to a fixed date format string. However, as we include timezone info in the formatting, this sometimes leads to problem, for certain timezone info in string, say, 2006-12-12 08:00:00.0 CTT, can not be parsed by BIRTs date parsing util.
As timezone information is actually not import in DtE, we use another pattern yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.S when do the date formatting. The bug is so that fixed.
Verified on build v20061211-0630

bug.short_desc: DBCS3.3: externalize strings failure if MANIFEST or plugin.xml has NL

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: 3.2.2 M20061129-0800
Steps To Reproduce: 1.create a plugin project with Hello World template 2.enter DBCS for provider 3.select PDE Tool > Externalize strings... then click finish
More information: i was unable to exit the wizard by clicking the finish button. 3.2 and 3.2.1 have this issue. Platform is WindowsXP Japanese. installing NL pack is easy way to recreate as the NL pack installs Japanese strings to Hello World template.
can you post any logs or give a better description of what is happening?

Created an attachment (id=56368) screen shots
ok, I'm attaching 4 screen shots with Eclipse 3.2.2 M20061220-1400 with NL pack 1.
1.png shows first state of externalize string wizard for Hello World template , and clicking Finish button kept open the wizard (2.png). without NL pack, the wizard was closed and properties file was created successfully. Then clicking Finish button still kept open (3.png), clicking Finish button several times (4.png).
Brian, since you're in this area at the moment, any thoughts?

I don't have much experience with NL bugs much less DBCS bugs. With taking more time to try to recreate the problem and run through it, I have no clue what could be going wrong. Sorry. When we get some time we can investigate this more.

Fuse-san, is anything written to the .log file when Finish is pressed?
Brian, I suspect the problem could be replicated on a WinXP English machine but you would need to get the 3.2.1 NL packs from the downloads page and run Eclipse in Japanese (use "-nl ja" command line arg).
Karice, no .log file nor no message in consolelog
I can reproduce this issue in 3.3 I20070517-1700 with NL pack.

I've debugged this issue. There was an exception at updating .properties file in doReplace method of ExternalizeStringOperation. escaped encode such as \uxxxx should be used to write NL string in .properties file.
I don't think that the escaped encode should be displayed in the Externalized string wizard dialog as it's hard to read.

bug.short_desc: [browser]RedHat EL4Update4, swt.browser cannot show with installed xulrunner 1.8.0.1

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: version:3.2.1, build id:M20061115-1052
Steps To Reproduce:
XULRunner1801 runtime reports "undefined symbol: g_assert_warning" error when embedding in Eclipse 3.2.1
Env: On RedHat EL WS4 Update4 Sun JVM 1.5.0_06 Eclipse 3.2.1 XULRunner 1.8.0.1 release
Step to reproduce: 1. Unzip Eclipse. 2. Download xulrunner 1801 release from:http://releases.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/xulrunner/releases/1.8.0.1/linux-i686/en-US/ 3. untar it, like /opt/xulrunner 4. Open a terminal 5. vi ~/.bashrc, put "export MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME=/opt/xulrunner". Save and exit 6. source ~/.bashrc 7. Start eclipse 8. View "Help Content", it starts with external FireFox. 9. Open View "Internet Web Browser", it shows error: No more handles (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /work/download/eclipse_3.2.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/68/1/.cp/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3235.so: /opt/xulrunner/libxul.so: undefined symbol: g_assert_warning) org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /work/download/eclipse_3.2.2/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/68/1/.cp/libswt-mozilla-gtk-3235.so: /opt/xulrunner/libxul.so: undefined symbol: g_assert_warning) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3400) at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3297) at org.eclipse.swt.browser.Browser.<init>(Browser.java:168) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.BrowserViewer.<init>(BrowserViewer.java:224) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.WebBrowserView.createPartControl(WebBrowserView.java:48) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ViewReference.createPartHelper(ViewReference.java:332) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.ViewReference.createPart(ViewReference.java:197) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPartReference.getPart(WorkbenchPartReference.java:566) at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Perspective.showView(Perspective.java:1675)
More information:
1) We can run /opt/xulrunner/xulrunner sampleapplication.ini to start a xul application. But we just cannot embed it in Eclipse. Does it caused by different LD_LIBRARY_PATH value at JVM?
2) Other system informations:
root@localhost eclipse_3.2.2]# java -version java version "1.5.0_06" Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_06-b05) Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_06-b05, mixed mode, sharing)
[root@localhost eclipse_3.2.2]# rpm -qa|grep gtk gtk-engines-0.12-6.el4 iiimf-gtk-12.1-13.EL.5 gtk2-2.4.13-19 pygtk2-2.4.0-1 gnome-python2-gtkhtml2-2.6.0-3 gtk2-engines-2.2.0-7.el4 gtksourceview-1.1.0-4 pygtk2-libglade-2.4.0-1 gtkspell-2.0.7-2 usermode-gtk-1.74-1 authconfig-gtk-4.6.10-rhel4.3 gtkhtml2-2.6.2-1 gtkhtml3-3.3.2-6.EL gtk+-1.2.10-33
[root@localhost eclipse_3.2.2]# rpm -qa|grep glib glibc-common-2.3.4-2.25 compat-glibc-headers-2.3.2-95.30 glib2-2.4.7-1 glibc-headers-2.3.4-2.25 dbus-glib-0.22-12.EL.7 glib-1.2.10-15 glibc-kernheaders-2.4-9.1.98.EL glibc-2.3.4-2.25 glib2-devel-2.4.7-1 compat-glibc-2.3.2-95.30 glibc-devel-2.3.4-2.25
[root@localhost eclipse_3.2.2]# rpm -qa|grep libstd libstdc++-3.4.6-3 compat-libstdc++-296-2.96-132.7.2 compat-libstdc++-33-3.2.3-47.3 libstdc++-devel-3.4.6-3
[root@localhost eclipse_3.2.2]# rpm -qa|grep fontconfig fontconfig-2.2.3-7 fontconfig-devel-2.2.3-7
GG is investigating this but doesn't have a fix yet for 3.2.x or HEAD.
Grant, what is the status of this for 3.2.2?

I'm still investigating this, but reverting the milestone since this is not fixed in this morning's 3.2.2 build. I believe that xulrunner's changed linking strategy expects that this symbol will be statically linked into the swt library, which is different from pre-xulrunner mozillas.

We have a proof of concept that using the XPCOM glue that comes with XULRunner 1.8, we can fix this. We are working on the fix for 3.3 HEAD. Right now, it seems too complex/dangerous for 3.2.2.
When the code is working in 3.3 HEAD, we can then evaluate a back port to 3.2.x.

Got some update for this problem. 1) With same environment, if we change the JVM to an old IBM JRE142, it works fine. Version info(early IBM 142): java version "1.4.2" Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2) Classic VM (build 1.4.2, J2RE 1.4.2 IBM build cxia32142ifx-20041203 (142SR1+80507) (JIT enabled: jitc)) 2) Use this IBM142, it also works fine with Eclipse 3.3 M4 build. 3) Eclipse 3.3M4/IBM JR50/RHEL4U4/Xulrunner-1801, still got same error.

bug.short_desc: [Actions] StepIntoSelectionActionDelegate "leaks" editor after close all

long_desc.thetext:
I20061129-1340
After working for a while, I closed all editors and then took a snapshot of who still holds onto editor instances. A StepIntoSelectionActionDelegate was the only reference to a CompilationUnitEditor:
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.javaeditor.CompilationUnitEditor fEditorPart of org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.ui.actions.StepIntoSelectionActionDelegate delegate of org.eclipse.ui.internal.handlers.ActionDelegateHandlerProxy handler of org.eclipse.core.commands.Command command of org.eclipse.core.commands.ParameterizedCommand command of org.eclipse.jface.bindings.keys.KeyBinding [417] of org.eclipse.jface.bindings.Binding[789] bindings of org.eclipse.jface.bindings.BindingManager bindingManager of org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench [Stack Local]

Moving to text for comment. The dispose method is being called on the action when the editor is closed, so somebody else must be hanging onto the action. Please move back to debug if we're supposed to be doing something else to avoid the problem.
Yes, I could set fEditor to null, but I think that might just hide another problem - i.e. references to the editor action delegates.

When pressing Ctrl+F5 the handler service seems to create the delegate (I'll attach allocation backtrace) and this seems to get stored in the command manager and when the editor gets closed this delegate seems to remain in the command manager and thus keeping a reference to the editor. Also, dispose() isn't called on this instance.
When debugging be careful not to touch other things otherwise you run into other leak bugs like bug 76077 or bug 167424.
Also note that this is not a full leak: only the last one is kept i.e. if repeating the scenario n times we don't leak n editors but just the last one.
Created an attachment (id=55406) Allocation backtrace for StepIntoSelectionActionDelegate when pressing Ctrl+F5
We should try to fix this for 3.3.
*** Bug 178640 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This is not a leak, but similar to bug 76077 is part of the handler lifecycle. It will always have the last part.
PW

It's still a leak, even if it only affects the last opened editor. The leak can persist for a long time if it occurs in an editor that is only opened once and then not used again for a long time (e.g. a PDE editor).

If it was leaked, it would be unrecoverable. It is a lifecycle issue.
Assigning it to the same priority as bug 76077.
PW

I've released an optimization for IEditorActionDelegates. After run(*) is called, we call setActiveEditor(action, null) to clear out the action delegate's active editor.
This doesn't address the popup contribution case, but does clear out the IEditorActionDelegate case.
PW

(In reply to comment #11)
Hmm, sounds scary. Javadoc of IEditorActionDelegate#setActiveEditor(IAction action, IEditorPart targetEditor) does not tell whether targetEditor can be null or not, so the official API default is that it cannot be null (although most if not all subclasses in the SDK are prepared to handle null).
IObjectActionDelegate#setActivePart(IAction action, IWorkbenchPart targetPart) explicitly mentions that targetPart cannot be null.

(In reply to comment #12) > > Hmm, sounds scary. Javadoc of > IEditorActionDelegate#setActiveEditor(IAction action, IEditorPart targetEditor) > does not tell whether targetEditor can be null or not, so the official API
You are correct. I had seen that method called with null but it is the text actions specifically. I wasn't able to reproduce a case where EditorActionPlugin called its delegate with null.
> IObjectActionDelegate#setActivePart(IAction action, IWorkbenchPart targetPart) > explicitly mentions that targetPart cannot be null.
That's why we didn't try to optimize both ... I'll back out the optimization. PW

Given the lifecycle methods on IObjectActionDelegate, the only way I see to fix this in a backwards compatible way is to have the workbench let go of the delegates more eagerly than it does now (being sure to call dispose() if it implements IActionDelegate2), and recreating them when needed again.
Likewise for IEditorActionDelegate, though they can stay around as long as at least one editor of the given type is open (e.g. optimistically pick the next most recently active editor when one editor is closed).
*** Bug 182963 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Note: the fact that the workbench is treating XML-registered IActions like singletons is a bug. bug 127133, to be precise. The consequence is that actions can become totally unusable if they appear twice on the same menu tree.
I suspect that, once we follow through the chain of API contracts, we'll find that the action delegates can't be singletons either... that is, the current lifecycle is a bug - it needs to be fixed both for memory issues and correctness issues.
Having a lot of delegates around also creates a performance problem. When profiling selection and focus changes, I found that a good chunk of CPU time was going into sending unused selection information to unused action delegates. See bug 95155.
In other words, I suspect that this bug, bug 95155, and bug 127133 could all be fixed by a refactoring of the action delegate structures.

Created an attachment (id=76800) ActionDelegateHandlerProxy v01
The equivalent brute force fix for the keybinding to legacy action bridge, similar to bug 73872
PW
Paul, I didn't look at the "brute force" patch. How does it behave regarding performance?

There are similar performance characteristics to bug 73872 comment #4
The difference here is that unlike bug 73872 which applies the part change to all ObjectPluginActions that are in the context menu, handler proxies apply their changes only when the command is executed against a specific part. For any give part close there should be less delegates to dispose.
PW

(In reply to comment #17) > Created an attachment (id=76800) [details] > ActionDelegateHandlerProxy v01 >
Released to HEAD >20070910 PW
As of code in HEAD this is not fixed, see bug 202994.

(In reply to comment #21) > As of code in HEAD this is not fixed, see bug 202994.
This refers to another bug. PW
Since there's now always a "leak" on close, the steps from comment 2 still reveal the "leak" and hence they are not fixed. That's all I wanted to point out.
dispose the delegate if the part is closed PW
Verified in I20070921-0919.
